To the chief Musician<S>5329</S> upon Shushaneduth<S>7802</S>, Michtam<S>4387</S> of David<S>1732</S>, to teach<S>3925</S>; when he strove<S>5327</S> with Aramnaharaim<S>763</S> <S>5104</S> and with Aramzobah<S>760</S>, when Joab<S>3097</S> returned<S>7725</S>, and smote<S>5221</S> of Edom<S>123</S> in the valley<S>1516</S> of salt<S>4417</S> twelve<S>8147</S> <S>6240</S> thousand<S>505</S>. O God<S>430</S>, thou hast cast us off<S>2186</S>, thou hast scattered<S>6555</S> us, thou hast been displeased<S>599</S>; O turn thyself to us again<S>7725</S>. <sup>Michtam: or, A golden Psalm</sup> <sup>scattered: Heb. broken</sup>
Thou hast made the earth<S>776</S> to tremble<S>7493</S>; thou hast broken<S>6480</S> it: heal<S>7495</S> the breaches<S>7667</S> thereof; for it shaketh<S>4131</S>.
Thou hast shewed<S>7200</S> thy people<S>5971</S> hard things<S>7186</S>: thou hast made us to drink<S>8248</S> the wine<S>3196</S> of astonishment<S>8653</S>.
Thou hast given<S>5414</S> a banner<S>5251</S> to them that fear<S>3373</S> thee, that it may be displayed<S>5127</S> because<S>6440</S> of the truth<S>7189</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
That thy beloved<S>3039</S> may be delivered<S>2502</S>; save<S>3467</S> with thy right hand<S>3225</S>, and hear<S>6030</S> me.
God<S>430</S> hath spoken<S>1696</S> in his holiness<S>6944</S>; I will rejoice<S>5937</S>, I will divide<S>2505</S> Shechem<S>7927</S>, and mete out<S>4058</S> the valley<S>6010</S> of Succoth<S>5523</S>.
Gilead<S>1568</S> is mine, and Manasseh<S>4519</S> is mine; Ephraim<S>669</S> also is the strength<S>4581</S> of mine head<S>7218</S>; Judah<S>3063</S> is my lawgiver<S>2710</S>;
Moab<S>4124</S> is my washpot<S>5518</S> <S>7366</S>; over Edom<S>123</S> will I cast out<S>7993</S> my shoe<S>5275</S>: Philistia<S>6429</S>, triumph<S>7321</S> thou because of me. <sup>triumph: or, triumph thou over me: (by an irony)</sup>
Who will bring<S>2986</S> me into the strong<S>4692</S> city<S>5892</S>? who will lead<S>5148</S> me into Edom<S>123</S>? <sup>strong: Heb. city of strength?</sup>
Wilt not thou, O God<S>430</S>, which hadst cast us off<S>2186</S>? and thou, O God<S>430</S>, which didst not go out<S>3318</S> with our armies<S>6635</S>?
Give<S>3051</S> us help<S>5833</S> from trouble<S>6862</S>: for vain<S>7723</S> is the help<S>8668</S> of man<S>120</S>. <sup>help of man: Heb. salvation, etc</sup>
Through God<S>430</S> we shall do<S>6213</S> valiantly<S>2428</S>: for he it is that shall tread down<S>947</S> our enemies<S>6862</S>.
